info.title: Web API Session Management library API
info.description: To access this API users/FP/TPP applications should be authenticated

servers.description: PROD Apigee endpoint for Staff to access the session management API

post.summary: Generates an Access Token can be Opaque/JWE/JWS token
post.description:
This API endpoint can be used to generate an access token on behalf of consumer from pingfederate. 

Note:

For authorization grant flow the token request should contain an authorization code (ref api /authCode endpoint for information on generation of an authorization code)

Based on the cookie configurations a secure cookie (also known as bind cookie) will be set in the http response headers.
Note that the access token contains claims that matches scn cookie name and value.

For a successful access to a protected API the PEP performs the following validations
 1. Verify the validity of Access Token.
 2. Verify if the cookie name and value from the http request header matches with the scn and scv claims of Access token.

patch.summary: Generates a new access token based on a refresh token.
patch.description:
This API endpoint can be used to renew an access token based on a refresh token. 
This API endpoint expects scn and srtcn cookie in the HTTP Request headers.
For successful token renewal the cookie value present in srtcn has to be decrypted.
Once srtcn is decrypted successfully the refresh token can be retrieved and exchanged with PingFederate for a new access token.

delete.summary: Revokes access token and refresh token
delete.description: This API endpoint can be used to revoke access token and refresh token by invalidating scn and srtcn cookies.

get.summary: Return session manager public keys as jwks
get.description: Return session manager public keys as jwks

X-Correlation-ID.name: X-Correlation-ID
X-Correlation-ID.description: Provided by up-stream system and the same is passed to down-stream system, to track the E2E application flow.

X-Request-ID.name: X-Request-ID
X-Request-ID.description: Provided by up-stream system and the same is passed to down-stream system, to track the request level E2E application flow.

X-IAM-Issuer.name: X-IAM-Issuer
X-IAM-Issuer.description:
Used to identify the PEP env

| S.No. | value  | description |
|-------|:---------:|:------------:|
| 1 | pep-apigee-rbs |  |
| 2 | pep-edi-nwb |  |
| 3 | pep-edi-nwo |  |
| 4 | pep-edi-iom | |
| 5 | pep-edi-ubn | |
| 6 | pep-edi-ubr | |
| 7 | pep-edi-nwi | |
| 8 | pep-edi-rbi | |
| 9 | pep-edi-group |
| 10 | pep-tyk-group | |

Note: This header should be added by PEP. if not set iss attribute in jwt will be taken to identify the PEP

X-IAM-Env.name: X-IAM-Env
X-IAM-Env.description:
Used to identify the IAM PF env.

| S.No. | value  | description |
|-------|:---------:|:------------:|
| 1 | edi-rbs | Points to Edinburgh LSP Zone 5 RBS Clustor |
| 2 | edi-nwb | Points to Edinburgh LSP Zone 5 NWB Clustor |
| 3 | edi-nwo | Points to Edinburgh LSP Zone 5 NWB Clustor |
| 4 | edi-iom | Points to Edinburgh LSP Zone 5 NWB Clustor |
| 5 | edi-ubn | Points to Edinburgh LSP Zone 5 UBN Clustor |
| 6 | edi-ubr | Points to Edinburgh LSP Zone 5 UBR Clustor |
| 7 | edi-nwi | Points to Edinburgh LSP Zone 5 NWI Clustor |
| 8 | edi-rbi | Points to Edinburgh LSP Zone 5 RBI Clustor |
| 9 | edi-group | Points to Edinburgh LSP Zone 7 Staff Clustor |

Note: This header should be added by PEP.

X-Domain-Name.name: X-Domain-Name
X-Domain-Name.description: Session Cookie created in the provided domain name. Note: This header should be added by PEP.

X-Path-Name.name: X-Path-Name
X-Path-Name.description: Session Cookie created in the provided path. Note: This header should be added by PEP.

scn.name: browser.bind.<UUID>
scn.example: browser.bind.<UUID>=<UUID>; Path=/; HttpOnly; Secure; Domain=natwest.com; Max-Age=2022-03-21T14:06:14.375+00:00

srcn.name: browser.state.<clientId>
srcn.example: browser.state.scheduler=<JWE>; Path=/; HttpOnly; Secure; Domain=natwest.com; Max-Age=2022-03-21T14:06:14.375+00:00

errorCode.description: error code return from downstream system.

errorMessage.example: Cannot create/update resource because it is not active

tokenType.description: Provide Token Type to get Access Token

code_verifier.description: The code verifier for the PKCE request, that the app originally generated before the authorization request. This will be supported only for CODE type

redirect_uri.description: The redirect uri for the PKCE request, that the app originally generated before the authorization request. This will be supported only for CODE type

response_type.description: What type of token is required after successful validation. by default will return access token, if required return id_token

scope.description: A random string generated by client application, which will be verified later by client. This will be supported only for JWS,JWE and REFID type

access_token.description: JWT bearer access token generated by ping federate

scope.description: A list of scopes applicable for the generated access token

token_type.description: Type of the access token returned by ping federate

id_token.description: id token contains the consumer details

refresh_token.description: refresh token contains the consumer details

InvalidRequest.description: The request was invalid, often missing a required parameter. More details in the response body

ServerError.description: There was an error within the Server. More details in the response body

UnauthorizedError.description: Access token is missing or invalid

InSufficientPermission.description: The caller doesn’t have sufficient permission

FileNotFound.description: The requested item doesn’t exist, or the URI requested is invalid

schema.example: browser.bind.<UUID>=<UUID>; Path=/; HttpOnly; Secure; Domain=natwest.com; Max-Age=2022-03-21T14:06:14.375+00:00

Set-Cookie.description: Set's access token to browser bind cookie. A configurable secure cookie. This cookie value is a randomly generated string linked to the scn and scv claims in access token

schema.example: browser.state.<clientId>=<JWE>; Path=/; HttpOnly; Secure; Domain=natwest.com; Max-Age=2022-03-21T14:06:14.375+00:00

\u0000Set-Cookie.description: Set's renewal status. A configurable secure cookie. This cookie hold an encrypted json string {'at':'access token','rt':'refresh token','exp':'expires in'}

schema.example: browser.state.<clientId>=<JWE>; Path=/; HttpOnly; Secure; Domain=natwest.com; Max-Age=2022-03-21T14:06:14.375+00:00

Set-Cookie.description: Set's renewal status. A configurable secure cookie. This cookie hold an encrypted json string {'at':'access token','rt':'refresh token','exp':'expires in'}

schema.example: browser.bind.<UUID>=<UUID>; Path=/; HttpOnly; Secure; Domain=natwest.com; Max-Age=2022-03-21T14:06:14.375+00:00

Set-Cookie.description: clear access token to browser bind cookie.

schema.example: browser.state.<clientId>=<JWE>; Path=/; HttpOnly; Secure; Domain=natwest.com; Max-Age=2022-03-21T14:06:14.375+00:00

AccessTokenRequest.description: Request for generating an access token

RenewTokenRequest.description: Request for renewing an access token

RevokeTokenRequest.description: Request for revoking an access token
